Reviews.Title: Love the Leica
Reviews.Author: doctim11
Reviews.Content: Picked up a Leica V-Lux 30 for my wife who wanted to get back into photography. She is doing close up / macro nature pics and this camera WILL focus down to 1cm away from the subject. Incredible. 12.1mb is adequate for our needs and the Leica lens is OUTSTANDING. We have had super-zoom single lens SLR's in the past and then got rid of them because they did everything mediocre, not this camera, it does everything well. The next step up would be a professional multi-thousand dollar camera and for under $1000 this Leica performs right up to the top of the line cameras.

Reviews.Title: Not an FZ150
Reviews.Author: Pounce
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Panasonic FZ150K, took a few pictures, and loaded them into my computer. The pictures looked not up to par.Then I bought the Leica V-Lux 3 and the pictures were stunning. I compared the two cameras, and there is no comparison. The image processing in the Leica is superior. 'Nuf said.

Reviews.Title: What I have wanted!
Reviews.Author: mrskbg "mrskbg"
Reviews.Content: So far, I love this camera! First, it fits my hand so comfy and balanced.  Not sure a man's hand will like tho. Controls are easy to see and function. Movable screen is a delight! Auto focus with stableizers excellent support exceeds my dreams. Now the final proof can only be seen in the quality of 24X enlarged printed pictures? I'll update when that is done with enough shots to evaluate. For now, thank you Leica, for the camera of my dreams!!!!!ps. Wish the flash was included and the correct card so I'd be ready to shoot out of the box and have no doubt what card to buy. Hard enough to wait to charge the battery!

Reviews.Title: German Spec Quality
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Leica V-LUX3 a "CLONE" of a Panasonic DMC-FZ150K ?????????I found from looking on the Leica Website and various on-line reviews that the Japanese made Leica lenses take 40 minutes for each element to be individually ground, polished and tested then the 1 to 4 coatings are added, (this camera has 14 lens elements) on Leica made imported machines, whereas the Panasonic models use mass production techniques on their own machines to a (minimum) Leica spec but with their own coatings including the own brand Panasonic Black Box Nano surface coating.Picture processing firmware (Panny uses its own Venus engine) for both have large differences as do the CCD qualities and manufacturing tolerances.  The CCD's are made by different manufacturers, the ones for the Leica brand are all tested but the Panny ones are only spot checked, differences in lens quality and coatings and firmware make for better colours and fewer aberrations at wide apertures.The V-LUX3 is 22 grams heavier again due to the noticeable extra build quality of all metal and electro-mechanical parts that's why Leica give a full unlimited 2 year guarantee against the 1 year Panny.The Leica comes with Adobe Photoshop Elements 10 and Adobe Premiere Elements 10 that would cost £150.Then finally resale value (average second hand)Panasonic DMC-FZ150K £205Leica V-LUX3 £350So there you have it identical apart from a "red badge" !!!! and street cred!You can always tell a Leica, by the way it takes pictures - and by the pictures it takes

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but...
Reviews.Author: P. Laird
Reviews.Content: This Leica is a great camera. The zoom is incredible, the basic operations are simple (most of them -- I'll get to that in a moment), the photos are wonderful, the battery holds a charge for a long time.But...... unlike EVERY other digital camera I have ever owned, the process of setting up the mode for the built-in flash is completely nonintuitive. I have looked at the manual a dozen times, played around with the on-screen menus repeatedly... and I STILL cannot figure out how to get to the flash mode settings. It's simply ridiculous on a camera this expensive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: JDP
Reviews.Content: Being a dedicated DSLR user I wasn't all that enthused about smaller "want to be" cameras until I came across this Leica V Lux 3. I picked this one up last spring while on a trip to visit friends in Louisville. After grabbing a sandwich I noticed a camera store a few doors down. Once I got a good hands on feel for this camera I left the store to give it some serious thought. The reduced price was also a big factor. The next day I came back and the rest is history.As everyone has well documented this Leica V Lux 3 does share most of its components with the Panasonic DMC FZ150. The difference between the two besides the included and not so free, Adobe Photoshop Elements and Premier Elements is all in the lens. The integrated 4.5-108mm F/2.8- F/5.2 ASPH lens is generous. ASPH is just a simple abbreviation for aspheric. It basically means at least one of the glass's elements does not have a spherical design or a constant radius curve. I've never been high on the so called super zooms mounted on point and shoots. This 24x is a first for me. Its sweet.Bigger isn't always better. The 12.1 megapixels is more then enough for me. At 12 full resolution frames per second, the CMOS sensor is great at capturing my shots. At reduced resolution of 3.5 megapixels it can be pushed to 60 fps. My still shots are just as good if not better then my Nikon DSLR. The color saturation and overall contrast in my outdoor photographs is outstanding. Even my distant shots come in perfectly sharp and in clear detail. Noise has not as big of an issue as I thought it would be.This camera does sport an image stabilizer for free shooting aficionados. Still nothing beats a tripod or a mono-pod. If that option isn't available I suggest going with anything stationary to help the shot. For dedicated auto mode shooters, the real jewel in this camera is the auto focus system. With auto focus each and every photograph can be a keeper.I don't shoot video with this camera but it is more then capable of handling it. It shoots a respectable 1920 × 1080 pixels in 60 fps in HD format. The editing tool allows for quick on board deletion vice downloading to clean up. The built in microphone is stereo and outfitted with a wind noise filter. Even though I'm an old school viewfinder guy, the swing out 3" LCD display is sharp and clean. Its one of the very few LCD screens that I do like.After four months of shooting, I have found myself reaching for this camera even more. For those quick shots or when I don't want to pack my Nikon gear the Leica V Lux3 has become the one. With a body similar to a slim downed DSLR, its a hard camera to put down. Whether one is a seasoned professional or the casual weekend user, I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It is a Leica
Reviews.Author: David H. Mead
Reviews.Content: Leica is very protective of their name and reputation. I am confident that Lecia is not taking a Panasonic camera (albeit a very good camera) and just putting their name on it.I got this camera for travel when I don't want to carry my Nikon DSLR. Photo's are as good or better than my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: another great camera from Leica.
Reviews.Author: herman burnett
Reviews.Content: Not one to gush over cameras but this one fit my needs to a T.Build is great,controls are excellent and IQ is outstanding.If you need a take along light weight camera,try this.

Reviews.Title: nice one for the price
Reviews.Author: dev
Reviews.Content: And finally i have a leica :)Good overall camera with fast auto focus and Great image quality.Could have a better build quality but photos come out great.A nice alternative for the panasonic(fz150) and fujifilm

Reviews.Title: Great camera, better than I expected.
Reviews.Author: A. Tse
Reviews.Content: Leica have been making excellent products.  This camera is still holding true to Leica's reputation.  Great camera for all condition.  I think I will enjoy taking more photo with it in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ed Thorne
Reviews.Content: The lens on this camera is amazing. For a light, quick flexible camera, this is the one. Years ago I was a professional photographer in NYC. Today I am a serious amateur still using Nikon equipment. This camera, however, is getting used more and more. At my grand daughter's soccer game I was able to get closeups from one goal to the other. Easy to learn but with seemingly endless variations in how it can be used.

Reviews.Title: Liking-the-Leica
Reviews.Author: Gone Bananas "GoneBananas"
Reviews.Content: Having owned 3 versions by Lumix, the snob in me  was eager to be an actual Leica owner.  I bought the V-Lux 3 and gave my Lumix FZ150 to my girlfriend.  Now we are shooting photos together and swapping notes. Function is identical, so until we get into the software part, I cannot tell the difference.  But I like the reaction from those who know the Leica name and even those who stumble over the pronunciation and never heard of it.  Initially, there was a problem with display in that photos would not appear in the LED screen after they had been snapped.  Situation seems to have resolved itself.  I still do not know if there is something amiss in the circuitry.  As of now, this is working fine and I love the camera which is perfect for a traveler like me who would miss countless pictures if I had to switch lenses constantly.  Also, I wander enough dicey territory that i wouldn't want the risk of losing thousands of dollars of equipment.

Reviews.Title: Leica or Panasonic?
Reviews.Author: L.Gauthier
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nice product. After investigation, it appears that the V-LUX 3 is a clone of the Panasonic DMC-FZ150.http://www.amazon.com/Panasonic-DMC-FZ150K-Digital-Camera-Optical/dp/B005HQ50SO/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1340624071&sr;=1-1&keywords;=fz150Panasonic uses Leica lenses for its camera, Leica uses Panasonic camera for its bridges.Thus the price may seems higher than required. Leica package includes additionnal software anyway.

Reviews.Title: Equal to cameras costing twice as much
Reviews.Author: Kr
Reviews.Content: I have had this now for about 8 months, and have to say it is really a great deal. The price/quality relationship is the best I have experienced with any camera. I was a little concerned about the 12.1 MP and doing prints, but this morning did some prints at 8 x 10 and they are truly spectacular. It isn't until you start working with the output of this camera in this way that you realize the quality of it. I have a family member who has several thousand dollar Nikon cameras and this has matched the photo quality in many (not all...let's be honest) cases. The camera really shines in close up work, and, oddly, the quality of photos taken in full telephoto mode are also outstanding. Absolutely nothing to not love about this camera.

Reviews.Title: unbelievable
Reviews.Author: jir
Reviews.Content: i purchased the camera because i wanted to start photographing my two and a half year old.  when it arrived, it felt light, cheap, and was small.  but i did not judge "a book by its cover."  When I learned the basics of the camera (enough to take pictures), I was blown away by the clarity, detail, and colors of the pictures on playback.  Now that I am learning more about the camera (reading the manual in its entirety), I am realizing all the amazing features of it.  I now love the "light, cheap, and small" camera, and would not trade it for anything else.  I did research before I purchased this, and forget your typical Canons or Nikons; Leica blows them away, both in price and features.  The camera's zoom lens is unbelievable.  The details you can capture are outstanding with the lens, which is standard, and the shutter speed option is fantastic, so I never miss a precious moment, which are hard to come-by when photographing a two and a half year old.  Definitely buy this camera, its awesome.

Reviews.Title: A Jewel Covered in Tatters
Reviews.Author: Hamid Moham
Reviews.Content: I've known Leitz optics since my student days, some 50 years ago.  The same excellence applies to V-Lux 3 camera, which I bought for my daily outings, in order to avoid weight of heavy gear on my neck. I registered the camera by mail. No confirmation or response came my way. After 4 months the focusing became erratic.  I had known their customer service as one of the worst in the industry.  They respond after a long time ringing, put you on hold forever & connect you to someone who is too busy for you !!  They are kind enough to take messages, but again they are too busy to respond.  So I followed the instructions on their 800 number & sent the camera to Leica, New Jersey.  No response again !!  So, a week later I sent the repair unit an email for an update.  The following day the customer service responded by email & said the repair would be completed in 2 weeks' time.  The following day UPS sent me an email indicating that Leica is sending me something by air !!  I received it in 2 working days.  It's now in perfect condition.  And the customer service had no idea what was going on.  This a jewel of a camera shrouded by ignorant confusing representatives.All in all it took 2 weeks to have my camera fixed.  Very reasonable.Therefore, the lens is excellent but the body thus far seems weak.  If someone asks me about a similar compact camera I would recommend Lumix FZ150, which by most accounts is identical to Leica, minus the red dot !!

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: flint anderson
Reviews.Content: ALL IN ONE MULTIUSE PRIMARY CAMERA.plus $300 less expensive since the V-LUX 4 came out.  superior quality, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: LEICA V-LUX 3
Reviews.Author: ANGELINA
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING CAMERA, It has far exceeded my expectations :-) I am very happy with my choice of camera - We'll done Leica!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: John Morris
Reviews.Content: Fantastic pro-sumer camera.  Picture quality is exquisite.  Good size - I don't find myself leaving it behind because it's "too much to carry".  The zoom is ridiculously awesome for the size/price.Be careful with downloading your Adobe software.  I clicked the download button twice because I thought nothing was happening, but sure enough, that used up both of my downloads and there isn't a THING that Adobe will do for you except allow you to pay for the most recent upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Compares favorably with our older Pentax 645AF and Pentax 67 medium format cameras
Reviews.Author: GBT
Reviews.Content: We're pleased with the quality of our images, and the features of this camera.We are enjoying this camera and would purchase another Leica

Reviews.Title: SUPER CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JULIO A. LECCHINI
Reviews.Content: RESOLUTION,QUALITY OF PICTURE/VIDEO IN ANY LIGHTING CONDITIONS, NATURAL, INDOOR OR OUTDOOR PLUS ITS SUPERIOR OPTICS INCLUDING THE 24X ZOOM AND THE RANGE OF SHOOTING OPTIONS MAKES THIS OWNER VERY PROUD EVERY DAY.VERY LONG BATTERY LIFE DOES HELP A LOT.

Reviews.Title: I have a Nikon D600 Frame and this Leica can go toe to toe with it!
Reviews.Author: Lido
Reviews.Content: Color...White-balance...focus accuracy and image quality of this Leica can in amny instances go toe to toe with a fullframe Nikon D-600.Quality control sets it way apart form Panasonic Lumix cameras.Leica has a bargain out there and it's called the V-Lux 3

Reviews.Title: Such Variety!
Reviews.Author: Madena Bennett
Reviews.Content: For whatever reason the included cord to attach the camera to my computer was wrong but that is my only complaint! I love the camera. The zoom capabilities on it are literally dizzying :)  And the close up or macro is gorgeous! I bought this camera after seeing the great pics my friend took with it...and I'm so glad I did! I think the pricing on it is cheap considering the high quality! Not super intuitive...I do have to read the instructions, but I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: adg8018
Reviews.Content: I know some ppl complain about this camera because its body is identical to Panasonic. lol~ Use it first and complain about it. Then you will not worry or complain. This is all I can say, guys. This camera is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Leica is always Leica!!
Reviews.Author: newportjazz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera because it's Leica. That's it!!So many people are saying similar review on this camera.In my opinion, Leica is always Leica for good or bad.Yes!! It is 99% Panasonic.  Made in Japan. So what.1% of Leica blood is still existing. It's good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: Leica - Once a great camera company, now going the way of Polaroid.
Reviews.Author: Silesian
Reviews.Content: Here's an example of Leica attempting to compete with all other camera manufacturers and still failing.  The Leica V-Lux 3 is nothing more than a re-badged Panasonic DMC-FZ150 like L.Gauthier stated in his review. Obviously, the five star reviewers have no idea that this is a Panasonic and what's funnier is that they rave about the fine Leica image quality without even realizing that Panasonic makes the entire camera. To make matters worse, it costs about $200 more than the Panasonic so please, save yourself the trouble and get the Panasonic. Leica was a great company back in the 70's and 80's but they failed to keep up with technology resulting in inferior camera products costing over $2000. The result: Leica sells re-badged camera's to help limit their yearly profit losses.

Reviews.Title: It feels cheap
Reviews.Author: Prudence
Reviews.Content: When you touch it,you will feel it is cheap.But it is Leica!So it doesn't matter!And you must buy a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Buy the Panasonic FZ150 Version and Save BIG!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This camera is identical to the Panasonic FZ150K, also sold on Amazon. The only difference is the almost double the price and some minor included software. Buy theanasonic then, if you really want it, buy the software separately. I purchased the FZ150K from Amazon. Great camera at half the price of this Leica. See my review at the FZ150 page.

ProductInfo.Features:
Extreme range of focal lengths
Video in full-HD quality
Sensationally fast
ProductInfo.Name: Leica V-LUX 3 CMOS Camera with 12.1MP and 24x Super Telephoto Zoom
